abdera.description: An implementation of the Atom Syndication Format and Atom Publishing Protocol.
abdera.name: Apache Abdera (Incubating)

accumulo.description: Accumulo is a distributed key/value store that provides expressive, cell-level access labels.
accumulo.name: Apache Accumulo (Incubating)

ace.description: A software distribution framework based on OSGi that allows you to manage and distribute artifacts.
ace.name: Apache ACE (Incubating)

activemq.description: A robust and high performance Message Orientated Middleware provider which will be integrated into Apache Geronimo but also be usable from inside any JVM.
activemq.name: Apache ActiveMQ (Incubating)

agila.description: Extensible Business Process Management (BPM) engine core.
agila.name: Apache Agila (Incubating)

airavata.description: A software suite to compose, manage, execute, and monitor large scale applications and workflows on computational resources ranging from local clusters to national grids and computing clouds.
airavata.name: Apache Airavata (Incubating)

allura.description: Forge software for the development of software projects, including source control systems, issue tracking, discussion, wiki, and other software project management tools.
allura.name: Apache Allura (Incubating)

alois.description: ALOIS is a log collection and correlation software with reporting and alarming functionalities.
alois.name: Apache Alois (Incubating)

altrmi.description: A transparent Remote Procedure Call bean.
altrmi.name: Apache AltRMI (Incubating)

ambari.description: Ambari is a monitoring, administration and lifecycle management project for Apache Hadoop clusters. (Formerly known as HMS)
ambari.name: Apache Ambari (Incubating)

amber.description:
The Amber project will deliver a Java development framework mainly aimed to build OAuth-aware applications.
            Amber graduated with the name Apache Oltu
amber.name: Apache Amber (Incubating)

any23.description: Anything To Triples (any23) is a library, a web service and a command line tool that extracts structured data in RDF format from a variety of Web documents.
any23.name: Apache Any23 (Incubating)

apex.description: Apex is an enterprise grade native YARN big data-in-motion platform that unifies stream processing as well as batch processing.
apex.name: Apache Apex (Incubating)

apollo.description: A robust implementation of the OASIS WS-ResourceFramework (WSRF) family of specifications
apollo.name: Apache Apollo (Incubating)

ariatosca.description: ARIA TOSCA project offers an easily consumable Software Development Kit(SDK) and a Command Line Interface(CLI) to implement TOSCA(Topology and Orchestration Specification of Cloud Applications) based solutions.
ariatosca.name: Apache AriaTosca (Incubating)

aries.description: The Aries project will deliver a set of pluggable Java components enabling an enterprise OSGi application programming model.
aries.name: Apache Aries (Incubating)

asterixdb.description: Apache AsterixDB is a scalable big data management system (BDMS) that provides storage, management, and query capabilities for large collections of semi-structured data.
asterixdb.name: Apache AsterixDB (Incubating)

atlas.description: Apache Atlas is a scalable and extensible set of core foundational governance services that enables enterprises to effectively and efficiently meet their compliance requirements within Hadoop and allows integration with the complete enterprise data ecosystem
atlas.name: Apache Atlas (Incubating)

aurora.description: Aurora is a service scheduler used to schedule jobs onto Apache Mesos.
aurora.name: Apache Aurora (Incubating)

awf.description:
AWF is a non-blocking, asynchronous, event driven high performance web framework running on the JVM.
            (Note: originally known as Deft, renamed to AWF on 2012-02-15)
awf.name: Apache AWF (Incubating)

axion.description: Relational database engine written in Java.
axion.name: Apache Axion (Incubating)

beam.description: Apache Beam is an open source, unified model and set of language-specific SDKs for defining and executing data processing workflows, and also data ingestion and integration flows, supporting Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIPs) and Domain Specific Languages (DSLs). Dataflow pipelines simplify the mechanics of large-scale batch and streaming data processing and can run on a number of runtimes like Apache Flink, Apache Spark, and Google Cloud Dataflow (a cloud service). Beam also brings DSL in different languages, allowing users to easily implement their data integration processes.
beam.name: Apache Beam (Incubating)

beehive.description: Extensible Java application framework with an integrated metadata-driven programming model for web services, web applications, and resource access
beehive.name: Apache Beehive (Incubating)

bigtop.description: Bigtop is a project for the development of packaging and tests of the Hadoop ecosystem.
bigtop.name: Apache Bigtop (Incubating)

bloodhound.description: Bloodhound is a software development collaboration tool, including issue tracking, wiki and repository browsing.
bloodhound.name: Apache Bloodhound (Incubating)

blur.description:
Blur is a search platform capable of searching massive amounts of data
            in a cloud computing environment.
blur.name: Apache Blur (Incubating)

brooklyn.description:
Brooklyn is a framework for modelling, monitoring, and managing applications
            through autonomic blueprints.
brooklyn.name: Apache Brooklyn (Incubating)

buildr.description: Buildr is a simple and intuitive build system for Java projects written in Ruby.
buildr.name: Apache Buildr (Incubating)

bval.description: The Bean Validation project will create an implementation of Bean Validation as defined by the Java EE specifications.
bval.name: Apache Bean Validation (Incubating)

calcite.description: Calcite is a highly customizable engine for parsing and planning queries on data in a wide variety of formats. It allows database-like access, and in particular a SQL interface and advanced query optimization, for data not residing in a traditional database. (Renamed from Optiq on 2014-09-30.)
calcite.name: Apache Calcite (Incubating)

carbondata.description: Apache CarbonData is a new Apache Hadoop native file format for faster interactive query using advanced columnar storage, index, compression and encoding techniques to improve computing efficiency, in turn it will help speedup queries an order of magnitude faster over PetaBytes of data.
carbondata.name: Apache CarbonData (Incubating)

celix.description: Celix is an OSGi like implementation in C with a distinct focus on interoperability between Java and C.
celix.name: Apache Celix (Incubating)

chukwa.description: Chukwa is a log collection and analysis framework for Apache Hadoop clusters.
chukwa.name: Apache Chukwa (Incubating)

clerezza.description: an OSGi-based modular application and set of components (bundles) for building RESTFul Semantic Web applications and services.
clerezza.name: Apache Clerezza (Incubating)

climate.description: A tool for scalable comparison of remote sensing observations to climate model outputs, regionally and globally.
climate.name: Apache Open Climate Workbench (Incubating)

cloudstack.description: CloudStack is an IaaS (“Infrastracture as a Service”) cloud orchestration platform.
cloudstack.name: Apache CloudStack (Incubating)

cmda.description: CMDA provides web services for multi-aspect physics-based and phenomenon-oriented climate model performance evaluation and diagnosis through the comprehensive and synergistic use of multiple observational data, reanalysis data, and model outputs.
cmda.name: Apache Climate Model Diagnostic Analyzer (Incubating)

commonsrdf.description: Commons RDF is a set of interfaces and classes for RDF 1.1 concepts and behaviours.  The commons-rdf-api module defines interfaces and testing harness.  The commons-rdf-simple module provides a basic reference implementation to exercise the test harness and clarify API contracts.
commonsrdf.name: Apache CommonsRDF (Incubating)

concerted.description: Apache Concerted is a Do-It-Yourself toolkit for building in-memory data engines.
concerted.name: Apache Concerted (Incubating)

cordova.description: Apache Cordova is a platform for building native mobile applications using HTML, CSS and JavaScript (formerly Phonegap). The project entered incubation as Callback, but decided to change its name to Cordova on 2011-11-28.
cordova.name: Apache Cordova (Incubating)

corinthia.description: Corinthia is a toolkit/application for converting between and editing common office file formats, with an initial focus on word processing. It is designed to cater for multiple classes of platforms - desktop, web, and mobile - and relies heavily on web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for representing and manipulating documents. The toolkit is small, portable, and flexible, with minimal dependencies. The target audience is developers wishing to include office viewing, conversion, and editing functionality into their applications.
corinthia.name: Apache Corinthia (Incubating)

cotton.description: Cotton is an Apache Mesos framework for running MySQL instances. (Formerly known as Mysos)
cotton.name: Apache Cotton (Incubating)

crunch.description: Crunch is a Java library for writing, testing, and running pipelines of MapReduce jobs on Apache Hadoop.
crunch.name: Apache Crunch (Incubating)

ctakes.description: cTAKES (clinical Text Analysis and Knowledge Extraction System) is an natural language processing tool for information extraction from electronic medical record clinical free-text.
ctakes.name: Apache cTAKES (Incubating)

curator.description: Curator - ZooKeeper client wrapper and rich ZooKeeper framework
curator.name: Apache Curator (Incubating)

cxf.description: The CXF project will create a SOA services framework by merges the ObjectWeb Celtix project and the Codehaus XFire project.
cxf.name: Apache CXF (Incubating)

datafu.description: DataFu provides a collection of Hadoop MapReduce jobs and functions in higher level languages based on it to perform data analysis. It provides functions for common statistics tasks (e.g. quantiles, sampling), PageRank, stream sessionization, and set and bag operations. DataFu also provides Hadoop jobs for incremental data processing in MapReduce.
datafu.name: Apache DataFu (Incubating)

deltacloud.description: Deltacloud, cloud API (REST) and abstraction framework
deltacloud.name: Apache Deltacloud (Incubating)

deltaspike.description: DeltaSpike is a collection of JSR-299 (CDI) Extensions for building applications on the Java SE and EE platforms.
deltaspike.name: Apache DeltaSpike (Incubating)

depot.description: Integrated tools for automating downloading, publishing and managing software artifacts, along with tools for manipulating their metadata.
depot.name: Apache Depot (Incubating)

devicemap.description: Apache DeviceMap is a data repository containing device information, images and other relevant information for all sorts of mobile devices, e.g. smartphones and tablets. While the focus is initially on that data, APIs will also be created to use and manage it.
devicemap.name: Apache DeviceMap (Incubating)

directmemory.description: DirectMemory's main purpose is to to act as a second level cache able to store large amounts of data without filling up the Java heap and thus avoiding long garbage collection cycles.
directmemory.name: Apache DirectMemory (Incubating)

distributedlog.description: DistributedLog is a high-performance replicated log service. It offers durability, replication and strong consistency, which provides a fundamental building block for building reliable distributed systems.
distributedlog.name: Apache DistributedLog (Incubating)

drill.description: Drill is a distributed system for interactive analysis of large-scale datasets, inspired by Google's Dremel.
drill.name: Apache Drill (Incubating)

droids.description: Droids aims to be an intelligent standalone robot framework that allows to create and extend existing droids (robots).
droids.name: Apache Droids (Incubating)

eagle.description: Apache Eagle is an open source analytics solution for identifying security and performance issues instantly on big data platforms, e.g. Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark. It analyzes data activities, yarn applications, jmx metrics, and daemon logs etc., provides state-of-the-art alert engine to identify security breach, performance issues and shows insights.
eagle.name: Apache Eagle (Incubating)

easyant.description: Easyant is a build system based on Apache Ant and Apache Ivy.
easyant.name: Apache EasyAnt (Incubating)

esme.description: Enterprise Social Messaging Experiment (ESME) is a secure and highly scalable microsharing and micromessaging platform that allows people to discover and meet one another and get controlled access to other sources of information, all in a business process context.
esme.name: Apache ESME (Incubating)

etch.description: A cross-platform, language- and transport-independent framework for building and consuming network services.
etch.name: Apache Etch (Incubating)

falcon.description: A data processing and management solution for Hadoop designed for data motion, coordination of data pipelines, lifecycle management, and data discovery.
falcon.name: Apache Falcon (Incubating)

felix.description: Implementation of the OSGi R4 specification. (Formerly known as Oscar)
felix.name: Apache Felix (Incubating)

fineract.description: Fineract is an open source system for core banking as a platform.
fineract.name: Apache Fineract (Incubating)

flex.description: Application framework for building Flash-based applications.
flex.name: Apache Flex (Incubating)

flink.description: Flink is an open source system for expressive, declarative, fast, and efficient data analysis. Stratosphere combines the scalability and programming flexibility of distributed MapReduce-like platforms with the efficiency, out-of-core execution, and query optimization capabilities found in parallel databases.  Flink was originally known as Stratosphere when it entered the Incubator.
flink.name: Apache Flink (Incubating)

flume.description: Flume is a distributed, reliable, and available system for efficiently collecting, aggregating, and moving large amounts of log data from many different sources to a centralized data store.
flume.name: Apache Flume (Incubating)

fluo.description: Fluo is a distributed system for incrementally processing large data sets stored in Accumulo.
fluo.name: Apache Fluo (Incubating)

freemarker.description: FreeMarker is a template engine, i.e. a generic tool to generate text output based on templates. FreeMarker is implemented in Java as a class library for programmers.
freemarker.name: Apache FreeMarker (Incubating)

ftpserver.description: A complete FTP Server based on Mina I/O system.
ftpserver.name: Apache FtpServer (Incubating)

geode.description: Geode is a data management platform that provides real-time, consistent access to data-intensive applications throughout widely distributed cloud architectures.
geode.name: Apache Geode (Incubating)

giraph.description: Giraph is a large-scale, fault-tolerant, Bulk Synchronous Parallel (BSP)-based graph processing framework.
giraph.name: Apache Giraph (Incubating)

gora.description: Gora is an ORM framework for column stores such as Apache HBase and Apache Cassandra with a specific focus on Hadoop.
gora.name: Apache Gora (Incubating)

gossip.description: Gossip is an implementation of the Gossip Protocol.
gossip.name: Apache Gossip (Incubating)

graffito.description: Portal oriented Content Management System (Formerly known as JCMS)
graffito.name: Apache Graffito (Incubating)

groovy.description: Groovy is an object-oriented programming language for the Java platform. It is a language with features similar to those of Python, Ruby, Java, Perl, and Smalltalk.
groovy.name: Apache Groovy (Incubating)

guacamole.description: Guacamole is an enterprise-grade, protocol-agnostic, remote desktop gateway. Combined with cloud hosting, Guacamole provides an excellent alternative to traditional desktops. Guacamole aims to make cloud-hosted desktop access preferable to traditional, local access.
guacamole.name: Apache Guacamole (Incubating)

hama.description: Hama is a distributed computing framework based on BSP (Bulk Synchronous Parallel) computing techniques for massive scientific computations, e.g., matrix, graph and network algorithms.
hama.name: Apache Hama (Incubating)

hawq.description: HAWQ is an advanced enterprise SQL on Hadoop analytic engine built around a robust and high-performance massively-parallel processing (MPP) SQL framework evolved from Pivotal Greenplum Database.
hawq.name: Apache HAWQ (Incubating)

hcatalog.description: HCatalog is a table and storage management service for data created using Apache Hadoop.
hcatalog.name: Apache HCatalog (Incubating)

hdt.description: Eclipse based tools for developing applications on the Hadoop platform
hdt.name: Apache Hadoop Development Tools (HDT) (Incubating)

helix.description: Apache Helix is a generic cluster management framework used to build distributed systems and provides automatic partition management, fault tolerance and elasticity.
helix.name: Apache Helix (Incubating)

heraldry.description: Identity for the rest of us.
heraldry.name: Apache Heraldry (Incubating)

hermes.description: A robust implementation of the OASIS WS-Notification (WSN) family of specifications
hermes.name: Apache Hermes (Incubating)

horn.description: HORN is a neuron-centric programming APIs and execution framework for large-scale deep learning, built on top of Apache Hama.
horn.name: Apache HORN (Incubating)

htrace.description: HTrace is a tracing framework intended for use with distributed systems written in java.
htrace.name: Apache HTrace (Incubating)

httpd-cli.description: CLI integration project for httpd server
httpd-cli.name: Apache httpd-CLI (Incubating)

ibatis.description: The iBATIS Data Mapper framework makes it easier to use a database with Java or .NET applications. iBATIS couples objects with stored procedures or SQL statements using a XML descriptor.
ibatis.name: Apache iBATIS (Incubating)

ignite.description: A unified In-Memory Data Fabric providing high-performance, distributed in-memory data management software layer between various data sources and user applications.
ignite.name: Apache Ignite (Incubating)

impala.description: Impala is a high-performance C++ and Java SQL query engine for data stored in Apache Hadoop-based clusters.
impala.name: Apache Impala (Incubating)

iota.description: Open source system that enables the orchestration of IoT devices.
iota.name: Apache iota (Incubating)

isis.description: The Isis project will be an extensible standards-based framework to rapidly develop and enterprise level deploy domain-driven (DDD) applications.
isis.name: Apache Isis (Incubating)

ivy.description: A java based tool for tracking, resolving and managing project dependencies.
ivy.name: Apache Ivy (Incubating)

jackrabbit.description: Content Repository API based on JSR 170
jackrabbit.name: Apache Jackrabbit (Incubating)

jaxme.description: Implementation of JAXB, the specification for Java/XML binding
jaxme.name: Apache JaxMe (Incubating)

jclouds.description: A cloud agnostic library that enables developers to access a variety of supported cloud providers using one API
jclouds.name: Apache jclouds (Incubating)

jena.description: Java framework for building Semantic Web applications.
jena.name: Apache Jena (Incubating)

johnzon.description: Implementation of JSR-353 JavaTM API for JSON Processing (Renamed from Fleece)
johnzon.name: Apache Johnzon (Incubating)

juddi.description: Implementation of a Universal Description Discovery and Integration (UDDI) registry
juddi.name: Apache jUDDI (Incubating)

juice.description: OpenSSL based JCE provider. Project going into retired status after lack of community interest.
juice.name: Apache JuiCE (Incubating)

juneau.description: Apache Juneau is a toolkit for marshalling POJOs to a wide variety of content types using a common framework, and for creating sophisticated self-documenting REST interfaces and microservices using VERY little code.
juneau.name: Apache Juneau (Incubating)

kafka.description: Kafka is a distributed publish-subscribe system for processing large amounts of streaming data.
kafka.name: Apache Kafka (Incubating)

kalumet.description: Kalumet a complete environment manager and deployer including J2EE environments (application servers, applications, etc), softwares, and resources.
kalumet.name: Apache Kalumet (Incubating)

kato.description: Kato is a project to develop the Specification, Reference Implementation, and TCK for JSR 326: the JVM Post-mortem Diagnostics API.
kato.name: Apache Kato (Incubating)

kitty.description: Kitty is a lightweight, production focused, Java-based application server performance diagnostic and management utility.
kitty.name: Apache Kitty (Incubating)

knox.description: Knox Gateway is a system that provides a single point of secure access for Apache Hadoop clusters.
knox.name: Apache Knox (Incubating)

kudu.description: Kudu is a distributed columnar storage engine built for the Apache Hadoop ecosystem.
kudu.name: Apache Kudu (Incubating)

kylin.description: Kylin is a distributed and scalable OLAP engine built on Hadoop to support extremely large datasets.
kylin.name: Apache Kylin (Incubating)

lens.description: Lens is a platform that enables multi-dimensional queries in a unified way over datasets stored in multiple warehouses. Lens integrates Apache Hive with other data warehouses by tiering them together to form logical data cubes.
lens.name: Apache Lens (Incubating)

lenya.description: Content Management and publishing system based on Cocoon
lenya.name: Apache Lenya (Incubating)

libcloud.description: libcloud is a standard client library for many popular cloud providers, written in python
libcloud.name: Apache Libcloud (Incubating)

log4cxx.description: Logging for C++. N.B. the code has re-entered the Incubator as log4cxx2.
log4cxx.name: Apache log4cxx (Incubating)

log4cxx2.description: Logging for C++. N.B. This is a reboot of the Log4cxx podling which previously graduated.
log4cxx2.name: Apache log4cxx2 (Incubating)

lokahi.description: The Lokahi project will create a management console for Apache HTTP Server and Apache Tomcat projects on a framework extensible to other ASF projects.
lokahi.name: Apache Lokahi (Incubating)

lucene.net.description: Lucene.NET is a source code, class-per-class, API-per-API and algorithmatic port of the Java Lucene search engine to the C# and .NET platform utilizing Microsoft .NET Framework.
lucene.net.name: Apache Lucene.NET (Incubating)

lucy.description: A loose port of the Lucene search engine library, written in C and targeted at dynamic language users.
lucy.name: Apache Lucy (Incubating)

madlib.description: Big Data Machine Learning in SQL for Data Scientists.
madlib.name: Apache MADlib (Incubating)

manifoldcf.description: Connectors for content repositories like Sharepoint, Documentum, etc.
manifoldcf.name: Apache ManifoldCF (Incubating)

marmotta.description: An open implementation of a Linked Data Platform.
marmotta.name: Apache Marmotta (Incubating)

merlin-developer.description: Merlin eclipse plugin merged with an existing eclipse plugin already at avalon.
merlin-developer.name: Apache MerlinDeveloper (Incubating)

mesos.description: Mesos is a cluster manager that provides resource sharing and isolation across cluster applications.
mesos.name: Apache Mesos (Incubating)

metamodel.description: MetaModel is a data access framework, providing a common interface for exploration and querying of different types of datastores.
metamodel.name: Apache MetaModel (Incubating)

metron.description: Metron is a project dedicated to providing an extensible and scalable advanced network security analytics tool. It has strong foundations in the Apache Hadoop ecosystem.
metron.name: Apache Metron (Incubating)

mnemonic.description: Mnemonic is a Java based non-volatile memory library for in-place structured data processing and computing.
mnemonic.name: Apache Mnemonic (Incubating)

mod_ftp.description: FTP protocol module for Apache httpd 2.x
mod_ftp.name: Apache mod_ftp (Incubating)

mrql.description: MRQL is a query processing and optimization system for large-scale, distributed data analysis, built on top of Apache Hadoop, Hama, Spark, and Flink.
mrql.name: Apache MRQL (Incubating)

mrunit.description: MRUnit is a library to support unit testing of Hadoop MapReduce jobs.
mrunit.name: Apache MRUnit (Incubating)

muse.description: A robust implementation of the OASIS WSDM, Management using Web Services (MuWS) specification
muse.name: Apache Muse (Incubating)

myfaces.description: MyFaces is a framework for building Java Server application GUIs based on JavaServer Faces (certified implementation of JSR-127).
myfaces.name: Apache MyFaces (Incubating)

mynewt.description: Mynewt is a real-time operating system for constrained embedded systems like wearables, lightbulbs, locks and doorbells. It works on a variety of 32-bit MCUs (microcontrollers), including ARM Cortex-M and MIPS architectures.
mynewt.name: Apache Mynewt (Incubating)

nifi.description: NiFi is a dataflow system based on the concepts of flow-based programming.
nifi.name: Apache NiFi (Incubating)

nmaven.description: .NET integration for Maven. Failed to build active community.
nmaven.name: Apache NMaven (Incubating)

npanday.description: NPanday allows projects using the .NET framework to be built with Apache Maven.
npanday.name: Apache NPanday (Incubating)

nuvem.description:
Nuvem defines an open application programming interface for common cloud application services, allowing applications to be easily ported across the most popular cloud platforms.
            The podling was voted to become part of Tuscany in Nov 2012 but (as of Aug 2014) nothing has happened. Tuscany was terminated in May 2016.
nuvem.name: Apache Nuvem (Incubating)

ofbiz.description: The Open For Business Project (OFBiz) is an open source enterprise automation software project.
ofbiz.name: Apache OFBiz (Incubating)

ognl.description: Object-Graph Notation Language implementation in Java
ognl.name: Apache OGNL (Incubating)

onami.description: Apache Onami aims to create a community focused on the development and maintenance of a set of Google Guice extensions not provided out of the box by the library itself nor the Google developers team, such as integration with 3rd part frameworks or extra functionalities.
onami.name: Apache Onami (Incubating)

oodt.description: A grid middleware framework for science data processing, information integration, and retrieval.
oodt.name: Apache OODT (Incubating)

oozie.description: Server-based workflow scheduling and coordination system to manage data processing jobs for Apache Hadoop
oozie.name: Apache Oozie (Incubating)

openaz.description: Tools and libraries for developing Attribute-based Access Control (ABAC) Systems in a variety of languages.
openaz.name: Apache OpenAz (Incubating)

openjpa.description: OpenJPA is an open source implementation of the Java Persistence API
openjpa.name: Apache OpenJPA (Incubating)

openmeetings.description: Openmeetings is a web conferencing solution.
openmeetings.name: Apache Openmeetings (Incubating)

opennlp.description: OpenNLP is a machine learning based toolkit for the processing of natural language text.
opennlp.name: Apache OpenNLP (Incubating)

openofficeorg.description: OpenOffice.org is comprised of six personal productivity applications: a word processor (and its web-authoring component), spreadsheet, presentation graphics, drawing, equation editor, and database.
openofficeorg.name: Apache OpenOffice.org (Incubating)

parquet.description: Parquet is a columnar storage format for Hadoop.
parquet.name: Apache Parquet (Incubating)

pdfbox.description: PDF library (reading, text extraction, manipulation, viewer)
pdfbox.name: Apache PDFBox (Incubating)

phoenix.description: Phoenix is an open source SQL query engine for Apache HBase, a NoSQL data store. It is accessed as a JDBC driver and enables querying and managing HBase tables using SQL.
phoenix.name: Apache Phoenix (Incubating)

photark.description: A Photo Gallery application, accessible via the web and written in Java
photark.name: Apache PhotArk (Incubating)

pig.description: Pig is a platform for analyzing large datasets.
pig.name: Apache Pig (Incubating)

pirk.description: Pirk is a framework for scalable Private Information Retrieval (PIR).
pirk.name: Apache Pirk (Incubating)

pivot.description: A platform for building rich internet applications in Java.
pivot.name: Apache Pivot (Incubating)

predictionio.description: PredictionIO is an open source Machine Learning Server built on top of state-of-the-art open source stack, that enables developers to manage and deploy production-ready predictive services for various kinds of machine learning tasks.
predictionio.name: Apache PredictionIO (Incubating)

provisionr.description: Provisionr provides a service to manage pools of virtual machines on multiple clouds.
provisionr.name: Apache Provisionr (Incubating)

pulsar.description: Pulsar is a highly scalable, low latency messaging platform running on commodity hardware. It provides simple pub-sub semantics over topics, guaranteed at-least-once delivery of messages, automatic cursor management for subscribers, and cross-datacenter replication.
pulsar.name: Apache Pulsar (Incubating)

qpid.description: Qpid provides multiple language implementations of the Advanced Messaged Queuing Protocol (AMQP)
qpid.name: Apache Qpid (Incubating)

ranger.description:
The Ranger project is a framework to enable, monitor and manage comprehensive data security across the Hadoop platform.
            (The podling was originally called Argus)
ranger.name: Apache Ranger (Incubating)

rat.description: Comprehension and auditing for distributions and source code
rat.name: Apache RAT (Incubating)

rave.description: Rave is A WEb And SOcial Mashup Engine.
rave.name: Apache Rave (Incubating)

reef.description: REEF (Retainable Evaluator Execution Framework) is a scale-out computing fabric that eases the development of Big Data applications on top of resource managers such as Apache YARN and Mesos.
reef.name: Apache REEF (Incubating)

ripple.description: Ripple is a browser based mobile phone emulator designed to aid in the development of HTML5 based mobile applications.  Ripple is a cross platform and cross runtime testing/debugging tool. It currently supports such runtimes as Cordova, WebWorks aand the Mobile Web.
ripple.name: Apache Ripple (Incubating)

rocketmq.description: RocketMQ is a fast, low latency, reliable, scalable, distributed, easy to use message-oriented middleware, especially for processing large amounts of streaming data.
rocketmq.name: Apache RocketMQ (Incubating)

s4.description: S4 (Simple Scalable Streaming System) is a general-purpose, distributed, scalable, partially fault-tolerant, pluggable platform that allows programmers to easily develop applications for processing continuous, unbounded streams of data.
s4.name: Apache S4 (Incubating)

samza.description:
Samza is a stream processing system for running continuous computation on
            infinite streams of data.
samza.name: Apache Samza (Incubating)

sanselan.description: The Sanselan Project is a pure-java image library for reading and writing a variety of image formats.
sanselan.name: Apache Sanselan (Incubating)

sentry.description:
Sentry is a highly modular system for providing fine grained role
            based authorization to both data and metadata stored on an Apache Hadoop cluster.
sentry.name: Apache Sentry (Incubating)

servicecomb.description: ServiceComb is a microservice framework that provides a set of tools and components to make development and deployment of cloud applications easier.
servicecomb.name: Apache ServiceComb (Incubating)

servicemix.description: The ServiceMix project will create an ESB and component suite based on the Java Business Interface (JBI) standard - JSR 208.
servicemix.name: Apache ServiceMix (Incubating)

shindig.description: The Shindig Project is an OpenSocial container.
shindig.name: Apache Shindig (Incubating)

shiro.description: Security framework. (Initially known as JSecurity or Ki, renamed June 2009)
shiro.name: Apache Shiro (Incubating)

sis.description: The Spatial Information System (SIS) Project is a toolkit that spatial information system builders or users can leverage to build applications containing location context.
sis.name: Apache SIS (Incubating)

slider.description: Slider is a collection of tools and technologies to package, deploy, and manage long running applications on Apache Hadoop YARN clusters.
slider.name: Apache Slider (Incubating)

sling.description: Sling is a framework to develop content centric web applications based on the idea of modularizing the rendering of HTTP resources.
sling.name: Apache Sling (Incubating)

socialsite.description: SocialSite is an OpenSocial-based headless social networking server and a set of OpenSocial Gadgets that make it easy to add social features to existing web sites. Server provides admin console for configuration, gadget approval and management. Gadgets can be combined to form complete UI for social networking with friending, group management and message support.
socialsite.name: Apache SocialSite (Incubating)

spark.description: Spark is an open source system for fast and flexible large-scale data analysis. Spark provides a general purpose runtime that supports low-latency execution in several forms.
spark.name: Apache Spark (Incubating)

sqoop.description: Sqoop is a tool designed for efficiently transferring bulk data between Apache Hadoop and structured datastores such as relational databases.
sqoop.name: Apache Sqoop (Incubating)

stanbol.description: A modular software stack and reusable set of components for semantic content management
stanbol.name: Apache Stanbol (Incubating)

stdcxx.description: The Apache C++ Standard Library project is a complete implementation of the ISO/IEC 14882 C++ Standard Library.
stdcxx.name: Apache stdcxx (Incubating)

stonehenge.description: Stonehenge is a set of interoperability scenarios for Service Oriented Architecture and Web Services that demonstrate interoperability between multiple systems including Apache Axis2, WSF/PHP and Microsoft WCF. The code also demonstrates good practice for standards-based interoperability.
stonehenge.name: Apache Stonehenge (Incubating)

storm.description: Storm is a distributed, fault-tolerant, and high-performance realtime computation system that provides strong guarantees on the processing of data.
storm.name: Apache Storm (Incubating)

stratos.description: Stratos will be a polyglot PaaS framework, providing developers a cloud-based environment for developing, testing, and running scalable applications, and IT providers high utilization rates, automated resource management, and platform-wide insight including monitoring and billing.
stratos.name: Apache Stratos (Incubating)

streams.description: Apache Streams is a lightweight server for ActivityStreams.
streams.name: Apache Streams (Incubating)

subversion.description: Subversion is an open-source version control system, with a long and detailed list of features. (See http://subversion.apache.org/features.html)
subversion.name: Apache Subversion (Incubating)

syncope.description: An Open Source system for managing digital identities in enterprise environments, implemented in JEE technology
syncope.name: Apache Syncope (Incubating)

systemml.description: SystemML provides declarative large-scale machine learning (ML) that aims at flexible specification of ML algorithms and automatic generation of hybrid runtime plans ranging from single node, in-memory computations, to distributed computations such as Apache Hadoop MapReduce and Apache Spark.
systemml.name: Apache SystemML (Incubating)

tajo.description: Tajo is a distributed data warehouse system for Hadoop.
tajo.name: Apache Tajo (Incubating)

tapestry.description: Alternative framework to JSP and Velocity scripting environments
tapestry.name: Apache Tapestry (Incubating)

tashi.description: An infrastructure for cloud computing on big data.
tashi.name: Apache Tashi (Incubating)

tez.description: Tez is an effort to develop a generic application framework which can be used to process arbitrarily complex data-processing tasks and also a re-usable set of data-processing primitives which can be used by other projects.
tez.name: Apache Tez (Incubating)

tinkerpop.description: TinkerPop is a graph computing framework written in Java
tinkerpop.name: Apache TinkerPop (Incubating)

tobago.description: A JSF based framework for web-applications.
tobago.name: Apache Tobago (Incubating)

trafficcontrol.description: Apache Traffic Control can be used to build, monitor, configure, and provision a large-scale content delivery network (CDN).
trafficcontrol.name: Apache Traffic Control (Incubating)

trafficserver.description: A scalable and extensible HTTP proxy server and cache.
trafficserver.name: Apache Traffic Server (Incubating)

trafodion.description: Trafodion is a webscale SQL-on-Hadoop solution enabling transactional or operational workloads on Hadoop.
trafodion.name: Apache Trafodion (Incubating)

triplesoup.description: SPARQL endpoint for your webserver. Project entering retired status after failing to get traction.
triplesoup.name: Apache TripleSoup (Incubating)

tsik.description: implementations of various W3C and OASIS specifications related to XML and Web services security
tsik.name: Apache TSIK (Incubating)

twill.description: Twill is an abstraction over Apache Hadoop YARN that reduces the complexity of developing distributed applications, allowing developers to focus more on their business logic
twill.name: Apache Twill (Incubating)

usergrid.description: Usergrid is Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) composed of an integrated database (Cassandra), application layer and client tier with SDKs for developers.
usergrid.name: Apache Usergrid (Incubating)

vcl.description: Virtual Computing Lab. Framework for creating, dispensing and running virtual images.
vcl.name: Apache VCL (Incubating)

vxquery.description: A standards compliant XML Query processor.
vxquery.name: Apache VXQuery (Incubating)

wadi.description: a robust hetorgeneous clustering engine used to cluster geronimo, tomcat, jetty and other containers eventually.
wadi.name: Apache WADI (Incubating)

wave.description: A wave is a hosted, live, concurrent data structure for rich communication. It can be used like email, chat, or a document.
wave.name: Apache Wave (Incubating)

whirr.description: Whirr provides code for running a variety of software services on cloud infrastructure.
whirr.name: Apache Whirr (Incubating)

wicket.description: A web application framework that focusses on bringing plain object oriented Java programming to the web tier
wicket.name: Apache Wicket (Incubating)

wink.description: Apache Wink is a project that enables development and consumption of REST style web services. The core server runtime is based on the JAX-RS (JSR 311) standard. The project also introduces a client runtime which can leverage certain components of the server-side runtime. Apache Wink will deliver component technology that can be easily integrated into a variety of environments.
wink.name: Apache Wink (Incubating)

wookie.description: a W3C widget engine with Google Wave and Open Social Extensions.
wookie.name: Apache Wookie (Incubating)

wsrp4j.description: Implementation of OASIS Web Services for Remote Portlets (WSRP)
wsrp4j.name: Apache WSRP4J (Incubating)

xap.description: Declarative framework for building Ajax-powered web apps
xap.name: Apache XAP (Incubating)

xmlbeans.description: XML-Java binding tool with 100% support for XML Schema and full Infoset fidelity
xmlbeans.name: Apache XMLBeans (Incubating)

zeppelin.description: A collaborative data analytics and visualization tool for distributed, general-purpose data processing systems such as Apache Spark, Apache Flink, etc.
zeppelin.name: Apache Zeppelin (Incubating)

zetacomponents.description: Zeta Components is a high-quality library of loosely-coupled PHP components.
zetacomponents.name: Apache Zeta Components (Incubating)
